chrome.tts

Top-Level Variables
tts: ChromeTts
Classes
ChromeTts

Use the chrome.tts API to play synthesized text-to-speech (TTS). See also the related ttsEngine(http://developer.chrome.com/extensions/ttsEngine.html) API, which allows an extension to implement a speech engine.

Top-Level Variables

static final ChromeTts tts

Accessor for the chrome.tts namespace.

Class ChromeTts

Fields
onEvent: Stream
Getters and Setters
onEvent: Stream<dynamic>
Methods
getVoices(): Future<dynamic>
isSpeaking(): Future<dynamic>
pause(): void
resume(): void
speak(String utterance, dynamic options): Future<dynamic>
stop(): void

Fields

final Stream onEvent

Getters and Setters

Stream<dynamic> get onEvent

Used to pass events back to the function calling speak().

Methods

Future<dynamic> getVoices()

Gets an array of all available voices.

Future<dynamic> isSpeaking()

Checks whether the engine is currently speaking. On Mac OS X, the result is true whenever the system speech engine is speaking, even if the speech wasn't initiated by Chrome.

void pause()

Pauses speech synthesis, potentially in the middle of an utterance. A call to resume or stop will un-pause speech.

void resume()

If speech was paused, resumes speaking where it left off.

Future<dynamic> speak(String utterance, dynamic options)

Speaks text using a text-to-speech engine.

utterance The text to speak, either plain text or a complete, well-formed SSML document. Speech engines that do not support SSML will strip away the tags and speak the text. The maximum length of the text is 32,768 characters.

options The speech options.

callback Called right away, before speech finishes. Check chrome.runtime.lastError to make sure there were no errors. Use options.onEvent to get more detailed feedback.

void stop()

Stops any current speech and flushes the queue of any pending utterances. In addition, if speech was paused, it will now be un-paused for the next call to speak.
